body_html: @cjblocker if you build from source on CentOS6, there's no issues. Our release blockers were of the nature "compile on CentOS6, run on a wide range of distros", and it had to do with libstdc++.so. We compiled fine on CentOS6 (using rhel-devtoolset3 because we compile binaries with gcc 4.9.2), but to run on CentOS6 out of the box (without devtoolset3, simulating userland), the out-of-box libstdc++.so has ABI incompatibilities with newer ones.

body: @cjblocker if you build from source on CentOS6, there's no issues. Our release blockers were of the nature "compile on CentOS6, run on a wide range of distros", and it had to do with libstdc++.so. We compiled fine on CentOS6 (using rhel-devtoolset3 because we compile binaries with gcc 4.9.2), but to run on CentOS6 out of the box (without devtoolset3, simulating userland), the out-of-box libstdc++.so has ABI incompatibilities with newer ones.
